clinical_study.brief_title: Avatrombopag for the Primary Prevention of Thrombocytopenia Induced by Cytarabine-based Chemotherapy in Patients With Lymphoma
clinical_study.official_title: Avatrombopag for the Primary Prevention of Thrombocytopenia Induced by Cytarabine-based Chemotherapy in Patients With Lymphoma: An Open, Single-center, Phase II Randomized Controlled Clinical Study

brief_summary.textblock: This phase 2 trial studies the efficacy and safety of Avatrombopag for the primary prevention of thrombocytopenia induced by cytarabine-based chemotherapy in patients with lymphoma

primary_outcome.measure: The incidence of grades III and IV thrombocytopenia

secondary_outcome.measure: The durations of any grade thrombocytopenia and grades II, III and IV thrombocytopenia

clinical_study.condition: Cytarabine Causing Adverse Effects in Therapeutic Use

arm_group.description: No intervention aiming at preventing thrombocytopenia will be taken after first cycle. Avatrombopag as salvage treatment will be administered to patients suffering from thrombocytopenia with nadir platelet count < 50 × 109/L at a dose of 60mg/day until there is drug-withdrawal indication.

As the primary prevention of thrombocytopenia induced by cytarabine-based chemotherapy, Avatrombopag will be administered at a dose of 60mg/day on days -3~-1 and 3~9, for a total of 10 doses. On the condition that patients have platelet counts <50 × 10 9 /L before next cycle, Avatrombopag will be administered at a dose of 60mg/day until there is drug-withdrawal indications. Platelet transfusions were administered to patients when the platelet count was less than 10×109 /L. Drug-withdrawal indications: PLT ≥ 100×109/L during salvage treatment or platelet count increases by 50×109/L, comparing with baseline level. When platelet count is higher than 400×109/L during this study, researchers determine whether avatrombopag is discontinued
